name: Millennium Maxwell House Nashville

reviews.text: When I originally got this hotel via Priceline I was incredible anxious after reading some of the reviews on this webiste but I must say there was no need for me to worry at all. Yes, the hotel is a long way from downtown (I do not recommend walking at all) and the rooms perhaps may need better sound insulation but my experience at this hotel was absolutely wonderful. From the moment I checked in (which was at 10:30ish in the morning), to the room I was given and to the shuttle drivers I could not ask nor want for me. I certainly will have no hesitation whatsoever to stay at this hotel again if I am ever in Nashville, TN. I am a traveller so I enjoy interacting with the locals of a particular city or town and I welcomed using the local bus network to get around and there are certainly two bus lines that stop close to the hotel. Just a final point, the hotel does not in the main have any free internet access (be it wifi or otherwise) but on the 6th floor of the hotel there is a computer that people can use free of charge - be mindful however it is primarily for the use of the airline staff that frequent this hotel.
reviews.title: Above Average

reviews.text: Only problem with hotel is their charging for internet usage and even having to use a credit card in the business center. First time I have seen this in a hotel in a very long time. Outrageous!
reviews.title: Free Wi-Fi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel was 3 miles from Downtown Nashville, but the Shuttle Service they have is brilliant like having your own private Taxi, just step out the Door and they are on hand to take you Downtown (Even if you are the only ones traveling), and a quick call to the Hotel and they will pick you up wherever you are, the Staff were really helpful, Room was clean and fresh towels daily, we had a great stay.
reviews.title: Best Shuttle Service Bar None

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel a year ago also and found that it has gone down hill a little. The breakfast buffet was awful. everything was cold and the selection of food was poor. I attended a banquet and I must say management needs to look around. It was located on the 10th floor and the view was beautiful, but the floor needed vacuuming and the chairs were very dirty on the back.
reviews.title: needs an update

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean but the bathroom shower needed new grout, there were stains and mildew.
reviews.title: An average stay

likes.disliked: — A bit unkept and the location

reviews.title: loved the experience
reviews.text: I have been staying at the Millennium Maxwell House, while I was visiting Nashville ,the overall impression that I had, was the hotel was spacious, clean,and the staff was very attentive, and polite,I went in to my room, which was located at the 9th floor, and the view from the elevator to the city was spectacular, got in my room, very spacious, large bathroom, very tidi,clean, color tv, toiletries, and of course, coffee.
There ia an ice dispenser machine on each floor, with cold drinks vending machine.
reviews.title: Never Again

likes.disliked: — price, charging for coffee, charging for local calls, did not have amenities advertised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel lobby overlook the patio, and the swimming pool is available ,also a nice bar with live music, the restaurant is situated next to the bar, food is good, and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Fit for purpose

likes.disliked: — Staff need to be briefed betetr

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By the elevator is situated the gift shop, they are run by a friendly couple, there, you can find anything you need, not just souvenir, but all kind of travel needs,including food and beverage.
reviews.title: Worst Place I have stayed to date

likes.liked: — it was lower priced then other hotels
likes.disliked: — the sad sevice and the bugs in my room

reviews.text: The Hotel is situated a few miles from downtown, but a shuttle service will be provided by the Hotel for free, and the staff will drop you downtown, to all the attractions, and they will pick you up at your convenience.
reviews.title: Nearly, but not quite.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is beautiful and room was lovely. The only down side was that the internet site is misleading because it looks like the hotel is in the thick of things when actually it is outside nashville but it does have a free shuttle service which more than made up for that. Staff were lovely and accomodating, nice pool, restaurant and bar.
reviews.title: great hotel- internet misleading

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The rooms were good sized and the bed was very comfortable. The shuttle service was great, we didn't have to drive anywhere. They dropped us off right at the steps of the Ryman Auditorium and the Country Music Hall of Fame and picked up right back up also. I would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Wonderful for the price...

reviews.text: She must have been quite a lady in her day. Now she is showing her age. The carpeting in the room was stained and worn in places. The mattress sagged a little. The bathroom was an adequate size, but there were a few chips in the tub porcelain. Also, there was a small amt of mold and some small staining on the bathroom ceiling. The shower pressure and drainage was fine. The hotel was very clean. The restaurant was reasonably priced for a nice breakfast. The outdoor pool area was beautifully landscaped. This is not in downtown Nashville, but courtesy van will take you where you want in downtown area. Stayed here because of Priceline. Wouldn't pay full price.
reviews.title: Showing her age

reviews.text: First of all, the photo on the hotel's website does not at all represent the actual hotel. From the website, it looks like the hotel is in downtown Nashville--in reality, it's surrounded by factories, about 10 minutes outside of town.
reviews.title: Unpleasant

likes.liked: — That I didn't have to pay for it?

reviews.text: The Maxwell House was ok. The bed was fine, the food was fine (if a little greasy). However, I had no hot water the first morning I was there, and when I called the front desk, they told me it would have to be fixed later.
reviews.title: Rude staff, poor service

reviews.text: I booked our stay through Hotwire and was pretty apprehensive when I looked at some of the reviews on TripAdvisor! I was expecting a nasty hotel room in a crime laden area with surly hotel staff.
reviews.title: Stop Scaring People!

reviews.text: Okay, it is not DOWNTOWN as listed in Hotwire. But there was a shuttle that would drop you off downtown and pick you up for FREE. We used the shuttle to go to Broadway and 2nd Streets. You have to call for the shuttle before 10:30 pm to be picked up, no big deal. We decided to take a cab back and the fare was $12. I parked my car upon arrival and never had to use it again until we left. That was nice if you want to have a drink with dinner.
reviews.title: Very dirty room, overall unpleasant experience

reviews.text: The hotel sits right off of I-65 in a large area with a nicely lighted lot. Across the street, sitting high on a hill, is a convent. There is NOTHING scary about the location of this hotel. In fact, the view of downtown Nashville was great from the glass elevators that take you to your room.
reviews.title: Just Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is older and there are some areas that could use some sprucing up, but the rooms and the lobby were good. I heard complaints about the elevator, but I never had a problem getting one quickly except when we checked out. But that was during a period when everyone else was also checking out and using the elevator. Have some patience.
reviews.title: Should call in a carpet cleaner company

reviews.text: Our room was small, but so what? I didn't go on this trip to sit in the room and the beds were comfortable. We spent a lot of time at the pool. Now that could use some work. It was clean but very cracked. I had to wonder how they managed to keep water in it.
reviews.title: It's OK..should've stayed right downtown.

aka: Millennium Maxwell House Nashville Hotel Nashville
